website_summaries.verdict: Beechwood hammer with an excellent swing. It feels great and works well.
cons: The wood may be too soft for some applications

customer_reviews.title: Quality cuts and machining
customer_reviews.text: So far I can say that the cut lines and smoothing is very well done. I do not regret this purchase. The mallet appears to be sturdy, balanced, functional and well crafted. You will have to finish this mallet yourself with a good tung oil or polyurethane, etc. Honestly, it's better that way so you can apply the finish or stain that you desire. I like natural finish that I can reapply once a year, you may not.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Mirkovich

customer_reviews.title: It feels strange to give a stick a rating?
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice wooden mallet. Just the right size, just the right weight and it is well made. Basically, it is a stick which makes it seem strange to write a review, but if you don't have this mallet, you're going to search around to find something else to use, which won't work as well, so just buy the mallet and keep it on hand when you need it. I've used mine a dozen times already just in a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Sigel

customer_reviews.title: Wood too soft.
customer_reviews.text: Wood is too soft to be very durable, every strike leaves a fairly deep impression. I will not get much use out of it before it is junked. Its ok if you have expensive tools that you dont want damaged by a metal hammer but i would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: gagokano

customer_reviews.title: Bora Wooden Mallet 4 1/2 " Beechwood
customer_reviews.text: Until you pair this wooden mallet up with a good set of chisels, you don't know how important and helpful it can be to woodworking and cutting notches or mortises. Sure, you can use your steel head hammer, but it hits too hard and can cause a chisel to gouge the work. But this wooden mallet is superb and adds just enough heft and measured impact to allow you to make your cuts and notches more carefully. It essentially teaches you to be more patient and improves your work. Five Stars!!
customer_reviews.author: EarthPlanner

customer_reviews.title: Crudely made
customer_reviews.text: It’s a wooden mallet. It will serve its purpose. However, for the price, I am underwhelmed. My example does not say “Made in England” like the Amazon pic, leading me to assume mine was made in a third world country. The fit and finish supports this theory. It arrived with a big chip off a corner face. Or perhaps it was damaged en route in the plastic bag the seller felt was adequate for shipment. I felt the need to spend 45 minutes sanding the tool because it was so rough. I wish I had selected one of the (much) cheaper options available on Amazon, and put the same amount of finish work into it. Disappointed to say the least...
customer_reviews.author: Forkstabbed

customer_reviews.title: Nice mallet but...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I pulled it out of the package I found that the handle was never totally finished and had areas that needed to be sanded and smoothed. I would have thought that would have been better considering these guys build mallets all the time. Other than that, it is a good working wood mallet.
customer_reviews.author: William Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size/weight
customer_reviews.text: It is almost too pretty to use! I put two coats of boiled linseed oil on to protect it. I find myself reaching for it for more than just chisel work. Great for tapping timer for adjusting alignment,too.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool, not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Solid build, the weight is really nice. Overall it's a good deal. It came unfinished and needed a bit of sanding on the handle, but 10 minutes of work got it tuned up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Be the Thor of your cocktail bar
customer_reviews.text: Simple, functional, and well made. Bought it to make hand-crushed ice for cocktails. A mint julep never had it so good.
customer_reviews.author: Max Prendergast

customer_reviews.title: NO Handle ???
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews but this product made me laugh. I ordered this and when it arrived there was NO handle, just the mallet head. ??? The mallet head seems pretty nice, good quality, but it is pretty useless without a handle. ???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not pretty
customer_reviews.text: Fit and finish were lacking. Seems sturdy. Would t complain of it was a few dollars less.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown!
customer_reviews.text: This product was advertised as made in England and when I opened it there was no indication where it was made and they appeared to be knock offs! I have another one which is authentic and the difference is significant.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Hits Things Good
customer_reviews.text: Not sure there needs to be much of a review on a mallet. You hit wooden things with it. This one is very adequate at that task.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking for a better mallet
customer_reviews.text: Seems like everything is being downsized. This Bora 540049 Mallet does work, but it is disappointing. the face of the mallet is narrow as is the handle, and it doesn't have much weight. The handle doesn't feel good in use, as it is barely rounded edges.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Prather

customer_reviews.title: Wood working or leather working mallet.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy with is good, I don't have to swing as hard as I was with the rubber mallet I was using. Well build, should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Solid...wood
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little mallet. I bought it for my chisels and joinery. It's a little on the light side, but works well.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mac.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and works well
customer_reviews.text: I've used it for breaking clumps of ice and woodworking. Good quality and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Nightdawg

customer_reviews.title: How to finish
customer_reviews.text: Finished mine with butcher block oil. Works well and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly useful and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Never had one of these before. I know now now that I have always needed one.
customer_reviews.author: WVD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect woodworking product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect weight, fits perfectly in hand when used for chiseling
customer_reviews.author: David V.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size and heft. I found it very useful during assembly and for pounding in dowels.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Now this mallet is awesome. First one I ever used but it is a pleasure to use. Good balanced weight and easy to use. I bought along with some mortising chisels. Never used either before but I have been now successful in hand forming mortises and tenons. love it
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: One Sweet Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Love this mallet. It makes easy work of mortising and general chisel operations. I'm going to buy a second one to convert into a dead-blow hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Cockfield

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a turner
customer_reviews.text: I started using this right away on the turning bench I designed and built. Great tool for a true woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: Wildlife

customer_reviews.title: Makes you feel like Norse god THOR the minute you grab it
customer_reviews.text: WOW, quality wood hammer. Makes you feel like Norse god THOR the minute you grab it.
customer_reviews.author: K011235813

customer_reviews.title: My first thoughts were the mallet felt good in the hand
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I just got this shipped to me. My first thoughts were the mallet felt good in the hand. It seems well crafted and after giving it a try found it works awesome at what it was built for
customer_reviews.author: Kurgen81

product_meta.title: Wooden Mallet 4 ½” Bora 540049, The Well-Balanced Beechwood Woodworking Mallet That’s Ideal for Solid, Damage-Free Striking
product_meta.description: Bora Tools, long known for quality woodworking products, again tips the scales with a high quality hardwood wooden mallet specifically designed for woodworkers. A wooden mallet (sometimes called a carpenters mallet or a woodworkers mallet) is a tool that may seem strange at first, but is essential for many applications, with woodworking being chief amongst them. Woodworking often calls for the use of chisels, with a hammer needed to tap / strike them. Rubber mallets do not offer the hard residence needed, and forget metal, as they are too heavy, and will also damage your tools. This makes a wooden mallet very necessary, and this is one of the finest you can buy. Made of premium kiln-dried European Beechwood, this 4-1/2 inch Wood Mallet comes with an angled face and a smooth, splinter-free grip handle, which is also tapered to keep the head rock solid. This creates unparalleled balance, and the 2”x3” face ensures ample striking force is applied with maximum comfort and control. Ideal for general joinery work and a perfect pairing with your favorite chisels, this wonderful wood mallet is made in England with old world craftsmanship and quality. Oh, it also looks great, and is perfect for crushing ice as well.
feature_bullets: Well balanced for precision and comfort , this wood mallet is carefully crafted to feel good in your hand while swinging and striking, you’ll know its quality workmanship the second you pick it up
Large hardwood striking face, made of hard, kiln-dried European Beechwood, the 4 ½” head (with 2”x3” striking face) allows for exceptional power, without damaging your material

Tapered handle for additional strength, the wood mallet head is secured by a 9” tapered Beechwood handle, making it impossible for the head to fly off, the handle is also smooth, splinter free, and easy to grip

Exceptional for woodworking and other uses, this woodworkers mallet (or carpenters mallet, if you prefer) is ideal for joining work, striking chisels, and other woodworking uses and it crushes ice like a champ as well (that makes it an ice mallet too)
Looks great, we know looks aren’t the most important feature when buying a wood mallet, but it doesn’t hurt, either, this one looks great on your pegboard, and is a tool you’ll be proud to own
